addLocation(Location) - Method in class Move
This method allows you to add a location to the move sequence.
addMultipleJumps(int, int, int[][], Move, Vector) - Static method in class Utils
This method will add all possible combinations of jumps that can be made from the row and column specified in the given board state.

B

BLACK_KING - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the short way of refering to a black king since all pieces should always be on a gray background
BLACK_KING_GRAY_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a black king on a square with a gray background
BLACK_KING_WHITE_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a black king on a square with a white background
BLACK_PAWN - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the short way of refering to a black pawn since all pieces should always be on a gray background
BLACK_PAWN_GRAY_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a black pawn on a square with a gray background
BLACK_PAWN_WHITE_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a black pawn on a square with a white background
BLACK_PLAYER - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents the black player option and is used to indicate that a square is occupied by the black player
BLANK - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the short way of refering to a blank square that a piece may move to since all pieces should always be on a gray background
BLANK_GRAY_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a blank gray square on the checkerboard
BLANK_WHITE_BACKGROUND - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This represents a blank white square on the checkerboard
BOARD_HEIGHT - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the number of squares high the checkerboard is
BOARD_PIXEL_HEIGHT - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is how tall our JPanel is going to have to be in pixels
BOARD_PIXEL_WIDTH - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is how wide our JPanel is going to have to be in pixels
BOARD_WIDTH - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the number of squares wide the checkerboard is
BORDER_SIZE - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the number of cells between the edge of the JPanel and the checkerboard panel in squares.

This method must be overriden by any subclass of this class.

This method intentionally does nothing because the move is determined by how the human clicks the checkerboard.

This method is called when the random player is supposed to choose the next move.

This method will determine whether or not a jump is legal.
canMove(int, int[][], int, int, int, int) - Static method in class Utils
This method will determine whether or not a move (not a jump) is legal.

CheckerBoardConstants - Interface in <Unnamed>
This interface is used to store the different constants that you may need when coding for this assignment.
CheckerPlayer - Class in <Unnamed>
This is an abstract class that must be inherited by every checker player you create.
CheckerPlayer(String) - Constructor for class CheckerPlayer
This is the constructor for a CheckerPlayer and should be called via super(...) whenever a subclass of this class is created.
Checkers - Class in <Unnamed>

This method is used to begin a new game of checkers.
checkForWinner(int[][]) - Static method in class Utils
This method checks for a winner given a board state and returns a value to indicate if it found one (RED_PLAYER, BLACK_PLAYER, or NEITHER_PLAYER).
chosenMove - Variable in class CheckerPlayer
This is the move chosen by a player when the calculateMove method is called.
col - Variable in class Location
This is the column on the checkerboard.

jumpExists(int, int[][], int, int) - Static method in class Utils
This method returns true if a jump exists from the row and column specified for the player specified by whos turn in the board state provided.

V

VALID_MOVE - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the value returned by the validMove method in the Utils class when a move is valid
VALID_MOVE_BUT_INCOMPLETE - Static variable in interface CheckerBoardConstants
This is the value returned by the validMove method in the Utils class when a move is valid, but not complete because it can jump more pieces or make a single first move without jumping pieces.
validMove(int, int[][], Move) - Static method in class Utils
This method is used to determine if a move is valid.
